I had this same problem just the other day because I was including the
weblogic.jar file in the junit classpath. It seems weblogic has some funny
manifest entries mentioning older ant (1.4, if i recall correctly) jars. I
had to re-include the ant.jar & optional.jar after weblogic to solve it. 
 
hope that helps. 
 
-pgm

-----Original Message-----
From: craigsdickson [mailto:craig.dickson@...]
Sent: Thursday, April 17, 2003 10:03 AM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [junit] NoSuchMethodError running from Ant


Anyone know what might cause this? I am on Ant 1.5.2, JUnit 3.8.1 and 
JDK 1.4.1.  It would appear as if there are some old JUnit classes 
being used during the ant exection, but I dont know where they are 
coming from.
